summary: Bahrain is a small country made up of many islands in the Persian Gulf. It has a long history, dating back to ancient times when it was known for its pearl fishing. The country has been ruled by different groups, including Arabs, Portuguese, and the Al Khalifa royal family. In the 19th century, it became a British protectorate and gained independence in 1971. Today, Bahrain is a monarchy with a growing economy, focusing on banking and tourism. It is home to over 1.5 million people and is a member of various international organizations.
title: Bahrain
